conclusion: Determine the ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity for a basketball.
Analyze the downward motion of the basketball.
Forces acting downwards: gravitational force and air resistance.
Net force acting downwards is mg(1 + λ).
Acceleration downwards is a_d = g(1 + λ).
Velocity just before collision is v_d = √(2g(1 + λ)H).
Analyze the upward motion of the basketball.
Forces acting upwards: gravitational force and air resistance.
Net force acting upwards is mg(1 - λ).
Acceleration upwards is a_u = g(1 - λ).
Velocity just after collision is v_u = √(2g(1 - λ)h).
Ratio of upward to downward velocities is √((1 - λ)h / (1 + λ)H).
The ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is √((1 - λ)h / (1 + λ)H).
